exceptions.exn: Abstracting over the terms "n" and "t" leads to a term fun (n0 : nat) (t0 : pos n0) => pos n0 -> forall v0 : vec (list bool) n0, (i, empty_stack) // (i, v0) ->> (3 + i, v0[nil/t0]) which is ill-typed. Reason is: Illegal application: The term "@pair" of type "forall A B : Type, A -> B -> A * B" cannot be applied to the terms "nat" : "Set" "list (bsm_instr n0)" : "Set" "i" : "nat" "empty_stack" : "list (bsm_instr n)" The 4th term has type "list (bsm_instr n)" which should be coercible to "list (bsm_instr n0)".

original: destruct x. - apply bsm_compute_POP_E. - apply bsm_compute_PUSH.
